title: The Intelligence - “It’s not a perfect system, but many are looking to Ghana as an inspiration”—a model election
summary:
Also on the daily podcast: the Brexit upside for Britain’s farmers and sacred deer make mischief in Japan“It’s not a perfect system, but many are looking to Ghana as an inspiration”—a model electionIN A REGION racked by dodgy polls, the country looks to continue a trend of uncontested handovers of power.
That is not to say, however, that there aren’t sticking points.
As tortuous Brexit negotiations drag on, we look at how British farming can and should change under a new regulatory regime.
And the starving deer of a Japanese tourist hotspot.
Runtime: 22minListen on: Apple Podcasts | Spotify | Google | Stitcher | TuneInFor full access to print, digital and audio editions of The Economist, subscribe here www.economist.com/intelligenceoffer
paragraphs: Also on the daily podcast: the Brexit upside for Britain’s farmers and sacred deer make mischief in Japan
“It’s not a perfect system, but many are looking to Ghana as an inspiration”—a model election

IN A REGION racked by dodgy polls, the country looks to continue a trend of uncontested handovers of power. That is not to say, however, that there aren’t sticking points. As tortuous Brexit negotiations drag on, we look at how British farming can and should change under a new regulatory regime. And the starving deer of a Japanese tourist hotspot. Runtime: 22min
